component.name: OpenAndroidInstaller
component.summary: Makes installing alternative Android distributions nice and easy.

description.p: The OpenAndroidInstaller project helps Android users to keep their smartphone's operating system up to date with free software and to continue using the device even though the manufacturer no longer offers updates. With a graphical installation software, users are easily guided through the installation process of free Android operating systems like LineageOS.

screenshot.caption: First step of the flashing progress

description.p:
This release v0.4.2-beta adds: Support for: OnePlus One (bacon) thanks to @MagicLike
Improvements: Switched from flashing to booting TWRP (only flashed for Samsung devices now) Supported device codes for a config are now a list; config is loaded based on this Add is_ab_partitioned device to config Support for OnePlus6TSingle under fajita Selectable text and markdown elements in the app If there are no instructions to unlock the bootloader, assume there is nothing to do and toggle automatically
